00061 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00062 //  CLASS : sc_string
00063 //
00064 //  String class (yet another).
00065 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00066 
00067 class SC_API sc_string_old
00068 {
00069     friend ::std::ostream& operator << (::std::ostream& os, const sc_string_old& a);
00070     friend ::std::istream& operator >> ( ::std::istream& is, sc_string_old& a );
00071 
00072 public:
00073 
00074     //  constructors
00075 
00076     explicit sc_string_old( int size = 16 );
00077     sc_string_old( const char* s );
00078     sc_string_old( const char* s, int n ); // get first n chars from the string
00079     sc_string_old( const sc_string_old& s );
00080 
00081 
00082     // destructor
00083 
00084     ~sc_string_old();
00085 
00086 
00087     // concatenation and assignment
00088 
00089     sc_string_old& operator = ( const char* s );
00090     sc_string_old& operator = ( const sc_string_old& s );
00091 
00092     sc_string_old& operator += ( const char* s );
00093     sc_string_old& operator += ( char c );
00094     sc_string_old& operator += ( const sc_string_old& s );
00095 
00096     sc_string_old operator + ( const char* s ) const;
00097     sc_string_old operator + ( char c ) const;
00098     sc_string_old operator + ( const sc_string_old& s ) const;
00099 
00100     friend sc_string_old operator + ( const char* s, const sc_string_old& t );
00101 
00102 
00103     // returns substring [first,last]
00104 
00105     sc_string_old substr( int first, int last ) const;
00106 
00107 
00108     // string comparison operators
00109 
00110     bool operator == ( const char* s ) const;
00111     bool operator != ( const char* s ) const;
00112     bool operator <  ( const char* s ) const;
00113     bool operator <= ( const char* s ) const;
00114     bool operator >  ( const char* s ) const;
00115     bool operator >= ( const char* s ) const;
00116     bool operator == ( const sc_string_old& s ) const;
00117     bool operator != ( const sc_string_old& s ) const;
00118     bool operator <  ( const sc_string_old& s ) const;
00119     bool operator <= ( const sc_string_old& s ) const;
00120     bool operator >  ( const sc_string_old& s ) const;
00121     bool operator >= ( const sc_string_old& s ) const;
00122 
00123     //
00124     // returns length of the string (excluding trailing \0)
00125     //
00126     int length() const;
00127 
00128     //
00129     // returns c-style string
00130     //
00131     const char* c_str() const;
00132     //
00133     // returns c-style string
00134     //
00135     operator const char*() const;
00136     //
00137     // returns character at "index" position
00138     //
00139     char operator[](int index) const;
00140     //
00141     // l-value subscript
00142     //
00143     char& operator[](int index);
00144 
00145     // formatted string (see printf description)
00146     static sc_string_old to_string(const char* format, ...);
00147     //
00148     //       conveniece formatting functions for common types
00149     //       e.g. sc_string_old("a=%d, s is %s").fmt(1).fmt("string")
00150     //       should produce: a=1, s is string
00151     //       it should be safe: if less arguments specified
00152     //       it should print %specifier; extra arguments should be ignored
00153     // TODO: if the type of the argument is incompatible with format
00154     //       specifier it should be ignored
00155     //
00156     // must have it inlined because of some compilers
00157     template<class T> sc_string_old& fmt(const T& t)
00158         {
00159             // search %
00160             int index;
00161             int last_char = length()-1;
00162             sc_string_old temp(*this);
00163             do
00164             {
00165                 index = temp.pos("%");
00166                 if(index == last_char)
00167                     return *this;
00168                 temp = substr(index,last_char);
00169             } while(temp[0] != '%');
00170             int f_len = (int)temp.fmt_length(); // length of format field
00171             temp = to_string(substr(0,index+f_len-1).c_str(),t);
00172             return (*this) = temp + substr(index+f_len,last_char);
00173         }
00174     sc_string_old& fmt(const sc_string_old& s);
00175     //
00176     // find position of substring in this string
00177     // returns -1 if not found
00178     //
00179     int pos(const sc_string_old& sub_string)const;
00180     //
00181     // remove "count" characters from "index"
00182     //
00183     sc_string_old& remove(unsigned index, unsigned length);
00184     //
00185     // insert "substring" before "index"
00186     //
00187     sc_string_old& insert(const sc_string_old& sub_string, unsigned index);
00188     //
00189     // returns true if the character at byte index in this string matches
00190     // any character in the delimiters string
00191     //
00192     bool is_delimiter(const sc_string_old& str, unsigned index)const;
00193     //
00194     // returns true if string contains the character
00195     //
00196     bool contains(char c)const;
00197     //
00198     // produce upper case string from this one
00199     //
00200     sc_string_old uppercase()const;
00201     //
00202     // produce lower case string from this one
00203     //
00204     sc_string_old lowercase()const;
00205     //
00206     // legacy methods
00207     //
00208     static sc_string_old make_str(long n);
00209     void set( int index, char c );
00210     int cmp( const char* s ) const;
00211     int cmp( const sc_string_old& s ) const;
00212 
00213 
00214     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const;
00215 
00216 private:
00217 
00218     sc_string_old( sc_string_rep* r );
00219 
00220     sc_string_rep* rep;
00221 
00222     void test(int position)const;
00223     unsigned fmt_length()const;
00224 };
00225

00227 // IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII
00228 
00229 inline
00230 ::std::ostream&
00231 operator << ( ::std::ostream& os, const sc_string_old& a )
00232 {
00233     a.print( os );
00234     return os;
00235 }
